textos_fuente.text: Fox's Lounge | South Miami Restaurant & Bar | South Miami's Neighborhood Bar Since 1946 0 Skip to Content Menus Dinner Beverage Happy Hour Gallery Happenings History Groups & Events RESERVATIONS Open Menu Close Menu Menus Dinner Beverage Happy Hour Gallery Happenings History Groups & Events RESERVATIONS Open Menu Close Menu Folder: Menus Back Dinner Beverage Happy Hour Gallery Happenings History Groups & Events RESERVATIONS Serving South Miami since 1946 Your neighborhood staple for great food & stiff drinks. Specials every day, drop by and say hi . FULL RESTAURANT & BAR * FULL RESTAURANT & BAR * FULL RESTAURANT & BAR * Post up with us Happenings Happy Hour Every Day, 4:00 pm - 6:00 pm Read More → Martini Mondays Every Monday, 8:00 pm - Close Read More → Margarita Martes (Tuesday) Every Tuesday, 8 pm - Close Read More → Wing It Wednesday Every Wednesday, 4 pm - 11 pm. Read More → Weekend DJs Fridays and Saturdays Read More → We’ve been here a while. Dig in to our storied past. Learn More The Buzz Oscar T. Great service, great food, and strong drinks, in a cool vibe environment. Daniela D. The ambiance was perfect for a dinner date--warm, intimate, and inviting. Sonia A. Cozy little spot to meet up for a quick girls night out, friend meet up or date! Albert B. The overall experience is a casual, comfortable, and nostalgic atmosphere to chill and catch up with friends over drinks. Howard F. Hard to believe, been going there since the fifties. Come on back. Carla W. Classic joint. Glad to have experienced the original. Cheers to recreating a historic favorite. Matthew B. Fox's is the definition of your neighborhood dive bar. All the stories you hear about 80's Miami comes to life in this place and you feel welcomed in the windowless lounge. Geraldine D. Super cool retro bar that perfectly blends old-school vibes with a modern touch. Visit Us 6030 S. Dixie Highway South Miami, FL 33143 (305) 703-6553 * * * * * * Hours of Operation Sunday - Monday: 4pm - 12am Tuesday - Saturday: 4pm - 2am Kitchen closes @ 11:00pm Book on Resy.com Now * * * * * * 10% off to all healthcare, government, law enforcement, military, teachers & students. Fox's Lounge South Miami | Rene Dahdah | South Miami CRE Sign in Subscribe Subscribe search News All Markets San Francisco New York South Florida Los Angeles Chicago National Texas Sectors Residential Commercial Development Politics Tech Data Dashboard Snapshots Articles Rankings Interactive Maps Directory Data Books Magazine Data Book 2025 Current Issue Issue Archives The Closing Weekend Events Miami Forum Building Houston Future City Salon Series New York Forum Golf Classic Industry Events Video + Podcast Video Podcast Partners Brand Studio Content Videos Collaborate Advertise Sponsor & Exhibit Engage Sponsored Content Appliance Innovation Hub Multifamily Index Newsletters Other About Us Contact Us Privacy Policy Subscribe Corporate Subscriptions Advertise Help Center Careers Shop Reprints South Florida A South Miami’s Fox’s Lounge sells for $7.5M, buyer plans adaptive re-use Fox's Plaza and Colliers broker Marcos Puente Dec 8, 2016, 8:00 PM UTC By Katherine Kallergis Save article SHARE THIS ARTICLE FONT SIZE A A A The once-popular Fox’s Lounge in South Miami has a new owner. Fox’s Plaza, marketed as a redevelopment opportunity, just sold to an out-of-state buyer for its asking price of $7.5 million. Tony Arrellano of Metro 1 Commercial Rene Dahdah sold the properties at 7435 Southwest 61st Avenue and 6022-6030 South Dixie Highway to S. Miami Retail BH LLC, according to a press release. The site hit the market with Colliers International South Florida broker Marcos Puente in August. Tony Arellano of Metro 1 Commerical represented the buyer. Puente said he received multiple offers at the asking price because of the lack of supply along U.S. 1. “It’s definitely not unusual in this market to have full price or over ask for good, quality real estate, especially in markets like South Miami,” Arellano told The Real Deal . Sign Up for the undefined Newsletter SIGN UP State records show an attorney manages the buyer, a Miami-based entity. Arellano declined to identify his client, but said they are from outside of Florida. The deal, which closed Thursday, has not yet been recorded. The buyer will renovate and re-lease the buildings, according to the release. The properties were marketed with approved plans for two four-story, mixed-use buildings with retail, office and apartments on the site, which currently includes two vacant buildings with 165 feet of frontage on U.S. 1 and land in the rear. Asking rents will be in the $65 per-square-foot range. The plan is to bring in “interesting and creative tenants” like those in Wynwood, Arellano said. The project, in the drawing stage, will be completed within a year. In all, the site has 48,350 square feet of land and 10,830 square feet of buildings. Dahdah , who paid $3 million for the parcels in 2009, closed Fox’s during the summer of 2015 with plans to build a mixed-use project himself. Fox’s, built in 1946, was open for nearly 70 years. Downtown South Miami and parts of Coral Gables along South Dixie Highway have become increasingly attractive to investors and developers. Nearby projects include Paseo de la Riviera , a mixed-use development on the Holiday Inn site in the Gables, the planned redevelopment of the Shops at Sunset Place , and a handful of smaller retail projects in South Miami. First National Bank of South Miami provided financing for the Fox’s deal, Arellano said. He declined to provide the loan amount. George Befeler, partner at Homer Bonner Jacobs, represented Dahdah and Denise L. Ben-David, partner at Waserstein Nunez & Foodman, represented S. Miami Retail BH LLC, according to the release. Learn why people trust wikiHow Categories Education and Communications Contacting Companies Contacting Media Outlets How to Contact Fox News to Make a Comment or Complaint Download Article Quickly & easily submit a request or suggestion to the Fox network Co-authored by Tami Claytor and Sophie Burkholder, BA Last Updated: January 12, 2025 Fact Checked Download Article Fox News Phone Number | Website & Social Media | Email | Mailing Address | Finding Answers Yourself | FAQs About Fox News Customer Service | Q&A | Tips | Show more | Show less X This article was co-authored by Tami Claytor and by wikiHow staff writer, Sophie Burkholder, BA . Tami Claytor is an Etiquette Coach, Image Consultant, and the Owner of Always Appropriate Image and Etiquette Consulting in New York, New York. With over 20 years of experience, Tami specializes in teaching etiquette classes to individuals, students, companies, and community organizations. Tami has spent decades studying cultures through her extensive travels across five continents and has created cultural diversity workshops to promote social justice and cross-cultural awareness. She holds a BA in Economics with a concentration in International Relations from Clark University. Tami studied at the Ophelia DeVore School of Charm and the Fashion Institute of Technology, where she earned her Image Consultant Certification. This article has been fact-checked, ensuring the accuracy of any cited facts and confirming the authority of its sources. This article has been viewed 1,201,534 times. If you have a comment, question, or news tip for Fox News, you can contact the network online, by phone, or by mail. Knowing the correct email address, phone number, or address for your specific concern will improve the likelihood of getting a reply or otherwise being heard. Below, we’ll give you the essential steps to contact Fox via phone, email, social media, and more! Fox News Contact Information Call Fox News customer service at 1-888-369-4762 or fill out their suggestion form on their help page. You can also tweet @FoxNews or send a Facebook message to the official Fox News page . Steps Section 1 of 6: Contacting Fox News by Phone Download Article Call Fox News at 1-888-369-4762 . Whereas some networks mostly encourage online submission of comments, Fox News does provide viewers with a 1-800 customer service number. You can use this phone number if you have a general inquiry, comment, suggestion, or concern. [1] X Research source Be prepared to go through a series of phone prompts when you dial the number. These prompts will direct you to the person or department you need to speak with. Advertisement Section 2 of 6: Contacting Fox News on their Website or Social Media Download Article 1 Fill out the contact form on the Fox News website. Go to the Fox News help page and select a topic from the dropdown menu. Then, fill in your personal information and message as prompted. Add any attachments you would like to, then submit your request. This portal is a great avenue for contacting the network with news comments, story corrections, or news tips . [2] X Research source If sending a correction or story question, specify when the story was on and what it was about. Corrections should be backed with outside, reliable sources . If sending in a tip, indicate the topic and location. Also, provide any sources you have to support or verify the tip. 2 Reach out to Fox hosts or shows on Facebook or Twitter. You can reach out to the main Fox News pages via their Twitter account or Facebook account . The hosts who are on Facebook and Twitter have social media buttons above their biographies on the Fox News website. Go to the Fox personalities page and click on the name of the person you want to contact. Then, click on the social media button in their biography. If you have a lengthy comment to make, a personal comment, or a simple comment but are not a “fan” of Fox News on Facebook, you will need to click on the “Message” button at the top of the Fox News Facebook page to send a private message . You can also send news tips by tweeting them to the main Fox News account or posting them on Facebook. Fox News is also interested in videos or photos of news happening in your area. 3 Find contact information for local affiliates on the Fox website. Go to this page and browse through the local affiliates to find the one you’re searching for. You can find each station's address, phone number, and website. Simply use the listed address and phone number for your local station to get in touch with a representative. Advertisement Section 3 of 6: Contacting Fox News by Email Download Article 1 Email the Fox News Press Office via irena.briganti@foxnews.com. Currently, Irena Briganti is the Group Senior Vice President of Media Relations at Fox News. You can send her an email to inquire about press releases and related topics at irena.briganti@foxnews.com . [3] X Research source 2 Email a specific Fox News show by finding their show contact page. Go to the Fox News show page and click on the show you're interested in contacting. Scroll through the page and look for a sidebar labeled "Contact the Show." Fill in your personal info and comments as prompted, then send your message. You can also look at the websites for specific TV personalities to find their email addresses. For instance, you can reach Sean Hannity at hannity@foxnews.com or Bret Baier through this link . 3 Email FOXaroundtheworld@foxnews.com if you live outside the US. If you live outside the United States but watch Fox News on the Internet or on television, let them know your suggestion, tip, or complaint by sending an email to FOXaroundtheworld@foxnews.com . You can also use this email address to let Fox News know that you would like to view their news channel even though the channel is not available in your area. Advertisement Section 4 of 6: Contacting Fox News by Mail Download Article Write Fox News at 1211 Avenue of the Americas, NYC. Contact Fox News the old-fashioned way by sending snail mail to their physical address. Send your correspondence to: [4] X Research source Fox News Channel 1211 Avenue of the Americas New York, NY 10036 Section 5 of 6: Getting Questions Answered Without Contacting Fox News Download Article 1 Use the Fox News help page for questions relating to television. The network’s website has a help page in which you can search topics you want information about; it’s probably a good idea to see if a frequently asked questions page answers your question before calling. Questions addressed include how to find jobs or internships at Fox News, where you can buy Fox News products, and issues with the Fox News App for Xbox 360. The page also addresses many programming questions, ranging from information on how polls are conducted to program scheduling. 2 Find answers to online-related questions on the help page. The network also has a help page devoted to answering questions related to its online products. This page includes information on the playing of videos and online commenting. [5] X Research source Technical errors addressed on this page include loading issues with stories on FoxNews.com and link issues. The page also provides information on signing into and deleting a FoxNews.com account. You can also sign up for breaking news alerts on the page. 3 Get help with mobile devices on the designated page. Fox also has a page that answers questions relating to mobile devices. You can find information about the Android and iPhone versions of the Fox News mobile app, as well as iPad accessibility and information about the Xbox app. Advertisement Section 6 of 6: Frequently Asked Questions About Fox News Customer Service Download Article 1 How do I get the Fox Nation Military & Veteran’s offer? If you’re looking to learn more about Fox Nation ’s Military & Veteran’s offer, watch this video demo to sign up as an existing customer or this video demo to sign up as a new customer. 2 How do I get the Fox Nation First Responders offer? Read through this complete tutorial from Fox News to sign up for their First Responders offer. You can also learn more about the offer at this link . 3 How do I contact Sean Hannity? If you want to get in touch with Sean Hannity —the current host of FOX News Channel’s Hannity —navigate to his official website and click the three horizontal bars at the top-right of the screen. Click Contact Us , then fill out the form to send a message to Sean Hannity and his team. 4 How do I contact Tucker Carlson? If you want to get in touch with Tucker Carlson —the former host of FOX News Channel’s Tucker Carlson Tonight —send him an email at tips@TCNetwork.com . [6] X Research source 5 How do I contact Jesse Watters? If you want to get in touch with Jesse Watters —current FOX News host—you can call him at (929) 286-7479 or email him at watters@Fox.com . R2_d2000 Top Answerer You can use a service like 10minutemail.com to get a temporary email address that will be deleted after ten minutes. Alternatively, you can create a regular email account, send your comment, and delete the account afterward. Thanks! We're glad this was helpful. Thank you for your feedback. It’s unlikely that a network is going to transfer your call to Sean Hannity or Lachlan Murdoch, for instance. Follow the operator’s prompts, which will direct you to the person or department you need to speak with. You can also write a letter and mail it to 1211 Avenue of the Americas, New York, NY, 10036. If you prefer to email, you can visit the Fox News website to find their email address for general comments, or the emails for individual hosts and show producers. Keep reading to learn how to send Fox News a correction or a news tip. Did this summary help you? Staff - Fox Cities CVB | Fox Cities CVB Skip to content 60 ° F 0 Saved Navigation Things to Do Outdoor Recreation Indoor Recreation & Amusements Museums & Historical Sites Shopping Family Fun Arts & Culture Live Music & Nightlife Spas & Wellness Fox Cities Original Experiences Found in the Fox Full Stream Ahead Hit the Trails Date Night For the Family Round of Applause Food & Drink Locally Owned Restaurants Bars & Lounges Events Annual Events Submit Event Fox Cities Snapshots Where to Stay Plan Your Visit Communities Getting Here & Getting Around Weather & Average Temperatures Travel Resources Fox Cities Visitor Center Destination Guide Deals E-Newsletter Sign-Up Group Tours Meeting Planners Sports Planners About Us Blog Home About Us Staff Staff Get to know us Meet the team that makes the magic happen! Administration Pam Seidl Executive Director Email: pseidl@foxcities.org I have the pleasure of leading this amazing organization and staff to ensure that we accomplish our mission of economic development through tourism. The Bureau serves as the source for independent information on tourism in the Fox Cities, ensuring all visitors, whether here for a convention, sports tournament or leisure travel have the best experience possible. The best view in the Fox Cities: It may sound odd, but the view heading West on the HWY 441 bridge across Little Lake Buttes des Morts at sunset. It's just beautiful. Favorite place to eat: The "sister" restaurants of Carmella's and SAP. Favorite Fox Cities attraction or event: Walking the Fox Cities Trestle over Little Lake Butte des Morts is my favorite outdoor activity and any of our local farm markets make for a great event Headshot location: Loop the Lake. It's a beautiful trail comprised of trestle bridges that connect 3 of our local communities. It's where I take my dog, Boyd, for a walk every night! Felicia J. Roddy Director of Finance and Administration Email: froddy@foxcities.org I oversee the daily operations of the Bureau, which include financial management, human resources, information technology, purchasing and overall office functions. The best view in the Fox Cities: High Cliff State Park. I love being able to take my horses there and ride on over 8 miles of trails. Favorite place to eat: It's a tie between Island Sushi and Dick and Joan's Supper Club. Both places are date night go-tos for my husband and I. Favorite Fox Cities attraction or event: There is always a great selection of shows to choose from at the Fox Cities Performing Arts Center. Headshot location: Lower Telulah Park Kayak Launch Marketing & Communications Cathy Trebatoski Director of Marketing Communications Email: ctrebatoski@foxcities.org My job is to help promote the Fox Cities region as a premier destination for tourism. I ensure that our strategic marketing, communications and branding work together to spread the message on why locals and tourists alike should plan their next vacation or staycation to the Fox Cities. Best view in the Fox Cities: I love the view of Lake Winnebago by the lighthouse in Kimberly Point Park. Favorite place to eat: Charlie's Drive-In, Hortonville. They are well known across the area for their cheeseburgers and homemade root beer. My favorite item is their BBQ sandwich which is similar to a sloppy joe. Favorite Fox Cities attraction or event: Pumpkin picking at Cuff Farms. I enjoy the scenic wagon ride through the fields where you can gather pumpkins of all shapes and sizes. There are lots of fun areas for the kids to play and an antique truck that is a great photo opp. Headshot location: Mile of Music mural. I love hearing original music from the eclectic array of up and coming artists that comprise Mile of Music. It's fun to rub elbows with bands as they join the audience to watch their fellow musicians perform. Bri Depies Digital Marketing Manager bdepies@foxcities.org I have the pleasure of promoting the Fox Cities on all digital platforms by developing and executing digital strategies. I showcase the inviting atmosphere, attractions, and events that make the Fox Cities a dynamic destination and draw people to visit. Best view in the Fox Cities: The beautiful Scheig Center Gardens in Appleton Memorial Park is so peaceful and always features beautiful seasonal flowers. It’s a wonderful escape, whether alone or with a loved one, and showcases the natural beauty of the area. Favorite place to eat: I love Waverly Beach Bar & Grille because of its unbeatable atmosphere. Relaxing on the outdoor patio, enjoying live music, and taking in the beautiful views of Lake Winnebago—all while enjoying a delicious sandwich—is the perfect way to spend an evening. Favorite Fox Cities attraction or event: One of my favorite events in the Fox Cities is the Downtown Appleton Christmas Parade. I have so many fond memories of bundling up and watching the parade with my family each year since I was a kid. It always kicks off the holiday season in such a magical way! Headshot location: Photo coming soon! Appleton Public Library. The newly renovated Appleton Public Library, which reopened in February 2025, serves as a dynamic space for community creativity, learning, and connection. Sports Matt Ten Haken Director of Sports Marketing Email: mtenhaken@foxcities.org My job is to help bring in as many visitors to the Fox Cities as possible through sports. Whether it is an arm wrestling competition, a youth soccer tournament, or a coaches' convention, I sell the Fox Cities as a destination for a variety of sporting events. The best view in the Fox Cities: From the Lower Softball Diamond at Sunset Park in Kimberly, you can see the Fox River just beyond the outfield fence. Favorite place to eat: Dick & Joan's Supper Club in Appleton to enjoy a drink in the lounge area, partake in the robust salad bar, and dig into a hearty meal. Favorite Fox Cities attraction or event: Enjoying a warm summer evening with friends at a Timber Rattler game at Fox Cities Stadium. Headshot location: Community First Champion Center. It's one of the premier sports tourism facilities in the country. Being involved with the project since the initial idea has been one of the highlights of my professional career. Abby McDaniel Sports Marketing Manager Email: amcdaniel@foxcities.org My job is to assist with promoting the Fox Cities as a premier destination for sporting events. The best view in the Fox Cities: High Cliff State Park as it captures the beauty and essence of the Fox Cities. Favorite place to eat: It's hard to beat the Friday Fish Fry at Mark's East Side. Favorite Fox Cities attraction or event: Cheering on the Wisconsin Timber Rattlers (and their grounds crew) at Fox Cities Stadium! Headshot location: Manderfield's Bakery. I love sweets and baking reminds me of spending time with my family in Minnesota. I love having that little reminder of home here in the Fox Cities. Group Sales Alison Hutchinson Senior Group Sales Manager Email: ahutchinson@foxcities.org I specialize in promoting the Fox Cities as a destination for meetings and conventions. My job is to work with our partners to bring new and existing groups into the area to stay in our hotels, sample our cuisine, visit local attractions and events, browse our many shopping venues and share their experiences with colleagues and friends. The best view in the Fox Cities: At 1000 Islands Environmental Center, there is a boardwalk trail that takes you along the river and I enjoy being surrounded by all of the natural beauty. Favorite place to eat: Stone Arch Brewpub, for their cheese curds, which are hand-made with the Stone Arch Scottish Ale, or the schnitzel with a creamy mushroom sauce. Favorite Fox Cities attraction or event: My favorite attraction is the Performing Arts Center. You can go to a Broadway show at the convenience of your own town. Headshot location: Bergstrom-Mahler Museum of Glass. It holds the largest, public collection of glass paperweights in the world. The best part is free admission! On your way out, check out the Museum Shop which has an array of original and affordable glass art. Lindsey Schultz Sales & Marketing Assistant Email: lschultz@foxcities.org My job is to support both the Sales and Marketing teams by promoting and sharing the fantastic destination that is the Fox Cities! The best view in the Fox Cities: My favorite view is from the East College Avenue bridge that goes over Little Lake Butte de Morts. I always have to take in the beautiful views each time I cross it. Favorite place to eat: I love Mill City Public House for their elevated take on typical "American bar food." Their burgers, sandwiches, tots, and more are all fantastic! If I am looking to get my Mexican food fix, I love Sangria's Mexican Grill. They have a large menu of great food and drinks; each option just as good as the last. Favorite Fox Cities attraction or event: I enjoy all of the walking trails that the Fox Cities has to offer. Places such as 1000 Islands Environmental Center for their winding board walks and nature views, or taking in the great view over Little Lake Butte Des Morts from Trestle Trail Bridge. Headshot location: Fox Cities Exhibition Center. The Fox Cities Exhibition Center is a multi-purpose convention center located in the heart of Downtown Appleton. The space is a draw for events such as large conventions, career fairs, and even sporting events. More About Us Board of Directors Our Board of Directors consists of an equal number of municipal representatives, hotel managers and owners, and community leaders who review and approve CVB policy, program, and budget. Learn More Annual Report Each year, the CVB creates an Annual Report showcasing the previous years' successes. Learn More Volunteer Opportunities Support the greater Fox Cities area by becoming a part of our team! Learn More Partner Portal Welcome, industry partners, to your one-stop-shop for CVB information and resources! Learn More Career Opportunities The Fox Cities Convention & Visitors Bureau is an economic development organization that strengthens the Fox Cities community and economy by investing in and promoting our destination. Learn More Tourism Development Grants The Fox Cities Convention & Visitors Bureau allocates a percentage of its room tax revenue for the development or expansion of visitor attractions and amenities. Learn More Email Newsletter Destination Guide Visitor Center 213 S. Nicolet Rd. Fox News Customer Service Phone Number (888) 369-4762, Email, Help Center Skip to content PissedConsumer Reviews Categories All Categories Media Auctions and Marketplaces E-commerce Food Delivery Footwear and Clothing Gambling and Lotto Transportation and Logistics Companies All Companies Amazon Meesho Temu Google YouTube TV KukuFM Blinkit Write review For Business Login Media Fox News 2306 Customer Service Updated on 08/31/2025 Contact Fox News Customer Service Reviews 0 Contacts Q&A Advertisements Fox News Phone Numbers and Emails Toll-Free Number: (888) 369-4762 Call customer service Send Message Media: (212) 301-3000 Fox News Emails: Customer Service Fox Around The World General Info Military and Veteran Legal Media Advertising Inquiries, Senior Executive Vice President, Corporate Communications, Vice President and Editor-in-Chief of FOX News Digital Is this your business? phone numbers and emails Advertisements Fox News Customer Service Overview The aggregated data is based on calls made from PissedConsumer.com website and questionnaires provided by PissedConsumer.com users. Fox News Customer Service is rated at 2.2 out of 5 . Consumers who contact the company are mostly dissatisfied . More commonly used way of contact is by phone . Source Distribution 81% phone 19% email The best phone number to call Fox News is 8883694762 . 87% of consumers used this number to address their issues and concerns. It is also considered the best number to call, as 18% of customers reported contacting a real person successfully. The average hold time is less than 1 minute . The longest wait times are on Wednesday , while the shortest are on Saturday . The average call time is 2 minutes . Be prepared for the call as Fox News may ask you for the following information to identify you as a customer: address or zip code, email or first and last name . View full overview › Fox News Overview The aggregated data is based on calls made from PissedConsumer.com website and questionnaires provided by PissedConsumer.com users. Fox News Customer Service is rated at 2.2 out of 5 . Consumers who contact the company are mostly dissatisfied . More commonly used way of contact is by phone . Source Distribution 81% phone 19% email The best phone number to call Fox News is 8883694762 . 87% of consumers used this number to address their issues and concerns. It is also considered the best number to call, as 18% of customers reported contacting a real person successfully. The average hold time is less than 1 minute . The longest wait times are on Wednesday , while the shortest are on Saturday . The average call time is 2 minutes . Be prepared for the call as Fox News may ask you for the following information to identify you as a customer: address or zip code, email or first and last name . People call Fox News mainly because of product/ service, request for information and account . 7% of the consumers who called the company’s customer support stated that their issues were resolved. Most customers feel unsatisfied after talking to customer service representatives. The best email to contact Fox News is ldepartment@foxnews.com . 35% of customers use this email address to address their issues and concerns. Customers evaluated the effort they needed to make to contact customer service as neither easy nor difficult . Close How to Contact Fox News Customer Service? Most Popular Number: (888) 369-4762 Total calls: 1 617 Issues resolved: 49 Last call: Sep 9, 2025 Rebecca A. Garland PissedConsumer Reporter What Is The Fox News Phone Number? If you want to contact Fox News Customer Service by phone, you should find the correct Fox News phone number to be heard and get a prompt reply. According to the Fox News contacts page, you may call the company at 1-888-369-4762 to submit a general inquiry, offer your suggestions or share your concerns. To get in touch with the required staff member or department, you will have to go through several auto-phone prompts. Be ready to spend some time on this. Unfortunately, this is the only phone number you may use to call Fox News Channel. How Do I Get Hold Of Fox News Customer Service By Chat? The Fox Help Center can be reached by live chat. The option is accessible from the company website Monday through Friday from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. PST and Saturday through Sunday from 7:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. PST. Please note that the timeframe can be changed during holidays. To start the Fox News support chat, click Chat with an Expert on the bottom right corner of the company website. You will need to fill out a support form. It is necessary to state your name and email address, then select the brand about which you want to inquire and the available option. Having stated the abovementioned data tap the Start Chat button. You can also submit the Fox News Customer Support form on the help page and one of their customer care representatives gets back to you within several minutes. How Do I Reach Out To Fox News Customer Service Via Social Networks? In addition to calling the Fox News Customer Service number, you can also offer your comments or news tips for the channel via social media platforms. You can reach out to Fox shows or hosts via Facebook or Twitter. Tweeting or messaging through social media networking is much easier than emailing the company since there is no single Fox News email address. You should fill in the Contact the Show form or find the email of the Fox News person you’d like to communicate to. You may follow Fox News on Facebook and Twitter, exchange private messages as well as comment posts, and get in touch with Fox News hosts using their social media accounts. Links to the official Fox News social media accounts are available on the company Help page.
